intro: Commelina monticola var. vestita, commonly known as the white-veined spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers with three petals and three sepals, often accompanied by prominent white veins. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
